  • Method Details

    • quickSort

      public static <T> void quickSort(T[] arr, int begin, int end, Comparator<T> comparator)
      Sorts the specified array of objects according to the order, inducing by the specified comparator. An average execution of this sorter is O(n log(n)). The worse case of this sorter is O(n^2). This sorting algorithm is recursive leveraging the divide-and-conquer principle.
      Type Parameters:
      T - is a type of element of the array
      Parameters:
      arr - is array for sorting
      begin - is the starting index
      end - is the last index for sorting
      comparator - is a tool for determining the sort order of array elements

    • partition

      private static <T> int partition(T[] arr, int begin, int end, Comparator<T> comparator)
      Method where last element is pivot. Then checking each element and swap it if it's value is smaller The difference between the elements is determined by the comparator.
      Type Parameters:
      T - is a type of element of the array
      Parameters:
      arr - is array for sorting
      begin - is the starting index
      end - is the last index for sorting
      comparator - is a tool for determining the sort order of array elements
      Returns:
      partition position
